qas.question: Who blockaded Switzerland's trade during World War II?

answers.text: by both the Allies and by the Axis

qas.question: What was severed in 1942, leaving Switzerland completely surrounded by the Axis?

answers.text: a crucial rail link through Vichy France

qas.question: How many refugees did Switzerland intern during World War II?
When did the financial relationship Switzerland had with Nazi Germany begin to raise controversy?
Where was the International Red Cross based?

context: Switzerland's trade was blockaded <a0_0>by both the Allies and by the Axis<a0_0/>. Economic cooperation and extension of credit to the Third Reich varied according to the perceived likelihood of invasion and the availability of other trading partners. Concessions reached a peak after <a1_0>a crucial rail link through Vichy France<a1_0/> was severed in 1942, leaving Switzerland completely surrounded by the Axis. Over the course of the war, Switzerland interned <a2_0>over 300,000<a2_0/> refugees and the International Red Cross, based in <a4_0>Geneva<a4_0/>, played an important part during the conflict. Strict immigration and asylum policies as well as the financial relationships with Nazi Germany raised controversy, but not until the <a3_0>end of the 20th century<a3_0/>.
